t1xlnRrxgmVOfQdSH2522A.text: Quality ingredients, pleasant spacy environment. We had chicken and bacon wrap with chips: unfortunately the chicken was grilled too hard so we removed it from the wrap, nonetheless the rest of the plate was well prepared with fresh ingredients. Excellent desserts (2 for price of 1). Good offering for children plate. Recommended after visit to London Eye, good price/quality but avoid grilled plates if you want to don't want to eat unhealthy black grillled ingredients.

c5sPX6UGL1entKtMbLNcXw.text: Situated just behind the gigantic London eye and next to the County Hall.I recently met my mother here for an afternoon drink and nibble. We ordered the most amazing mezze platter and it was filled with olives, cured meats, houmous, breads and cheese - we were very impressed.Situated just off the river Thames the clientele ranges from tourists, locals and business types. It was lovely to sit sip wine, eat nibbles and watch the London eye fill and refill with people. Not necessarilly the most exciting venue but it ws perect for a catch up and a quick nibble of yummy food.

photos.caption: Photo of Slug & Lettuce - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Slug & Lettuce - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Slug & Lettuce - London, United Kingdom

Auoe9_viHlhMo--BTXPHfg.text: The restaurant had a decent crowd going. Mostly locals and not to many tourist.

FZDXqpc_rySRRxzsrSXKfQ.text: 1990's called and would like their restaurant back. Ambiance is very faded  Bridgette Jones kind of way.

0dnxtzFfdJgBNbkfUXTA4Q.text: No thank you and would not reccomend this to anyone staff were not helpful some people waited ages to be served so much so they left .Avoid this place  i will

Fw0-rBBba9DCct-JHws7EQ.text: +2 star for the food for being edible and ok mojitos.-1 star for absent service (waitress disappeared for over 1/2 an hour)+1 star for cute name inspiring us to swing in when we were around the London eye.I get fish and chips now and then in the states as well, and this one was not among the better. But edible. Works in a pinch, I suppose.

KkU9rewqhcQpBE1n95ha0w.text: I went hear when I had a cold, my nose was running one way, my throat the other.  This small inconvenience, however, did not interfere with my brain.  I went there hungry.  At about 8:30.  On the menu, it stated - Food served until 9!  Ah destiny.  But destiny it was not.  Because little did we decide what we wanted to eat than our waitress came over and told us they were short one chef and the kitchen was subsequently closed.  Then, they were out of the kind of tea I wanted.  To top it off, the waitress seemed to avoid our table.  Maybe someone placed 'ignore me' signs on our backs and we didn't know it.  When we finally did get her attention, we asked her to bring over some biscuits - the kind that came with the hot chocolate.  She brought over a lot and we were happy as feet in warm slippers.  The place is overall okay.  I chalk up the mediocre service to some odd anomaly due to an absent chef.  Nevertheless, I wasn't so impressed that I felt an undying need to go back.  The desserts on the menu sounded delicious... if I go again, hopefully the kitchen will be open as stated.

afk4GLO-QQbCGqMMnYRA3g.text: The food here is not at all nice and I have been here a couple of times just on work do's and when showing people around London and I always regret bringing them here - unfortunately it is very convenient by Waterloo and by the London Eye but if you can, eat elsewhere. In terms of somewhere to stop for a pint its fine, really nothing special. The bar itself is ageing and the prices are too expensive even for London.

eNuVy4SFqIgbyNSwGvZmrQ.text: Unfortunately the toilets were in a very bad way. Food very average in fact I would say very poor. Dry Chicken, mash we think was smash and not onions on the sausage and mash. I would say this takes advantage of the hi volume of people in the area and assumes you will only come once, which is true for us

6D6vJGntW1VEJY0pUIbDeg.text: Good lunch place and reasonable priced. Friendly staff and a beautiful spot close to London Eye.We ordered the 7oz burger "the Swiss", but the meat was a bit on the dry side.

AwUTFwtaYund15b8_1FYig.text: One afternoon, we walked in, but no one greeted us. After a few minutes, we approached the bar, inquiring about seats. We were told that they were understaffed but that table service was available. We tried to find a clean table to no avail. We must have been at the dirty table for at least 30 minutes- no server approached us at all. We saw that other customers were frustrated as well. It was as if we were all invisible-- we never even received an "I'll be with you shortly." Of course, we left, so I can't offer any comments about their food. This establishment's name is fitting indeed.

MMi9pk_5YDwQE_g_IdVLDQ.text: If you're gonna ask me how I'd like my steak done, then do it how I told you! When I ask for "medium rare, closer to rare", I expect at the very minimum for the meat to be pink, preferably still bleeding a little. The steak I was served was definitely a well done, dry with hardly any juice, & not a bit of pink anywhere in the middle. This was my second visit, to try their Monday half priced food. Last week a friend brought me for dinner & everything we wanted on the menu was not available, so we had the seafood basket, which is really a fancy name for frozen crumbed food you get get from boxes in the supermarket, deep fried for too long. Basically everything here is just overcooked.I'm only giving this two stars for value for money on Mondays. Any other day of the week, this place is a damn rip off. Never coming back here again, even if I lived in London.

_pFJ0X0xYzucZs16HBwwrg.text: Meh, it's right next to the Eye which is nice, but the food is a little underwhelming.  I order the Tiki Masala, I've had better frozen.  My daughter ordered the vegetarian burger which came out cold.  The rest of the fam ordered the Open Chicken Pot Pie and it was just plain, needed salt and pepper all around.  Service was ok, waitress made it right for the cold burger, but we had to wait for it for awhile.   All in all, kind of boring and food was no better than fast food.

vdiAE8y1G5jN3Y1jDuZzdg.text: I've eaten at another Slug and Lettuce location before and it was amazing! I ordered the Southern chicken wrap and I definitely was up for trying it again. I got off at Westminster and walked around and saw it again so I went in. First off, nobody seated me. There was obnoxious music playing everywhere and so I went and sat down and nobody came. I went up and they told me they would just take my order up there. I ordered the same thing that I loved at the other location. It was HORRIBLE here. I was so hungry and couldn't even finish it here. It was absolutely gross and the meat and tortilla were dry. Go to another location, don't come to this one.

vgUxcEjdtoGKpzCdHfe0QQ.text: Fantastic family friendly restaurant near the London Eye and Westminster Bridge.  Monday's are best because it's half price on everything.  Expansive menu means everyone's happy - no whining!Burgers are great as are more British options like the meat pies.  Too full for dessert but desserts are always 2 for 1 so come hungry as there was plenty to delight!

iR0_hI69Np9RFFg_539nug.text: Italian Burger: Chicken undercooked - still a jelly texture, and tasted of dirty grill, old single lettuce leaf, hard bun, tasteless tomato.Coleslaw: warm.Chips: Great. They do good solid pub chips.

dzib5RaIFWsrin7SA7KdWg.text: Excelent location with a fun atmosphere. Good drinks and a fun place. The food is fine, the breakfast better.

5iuqPlok0Ec5_2wOwGMscw.text: The menu here is great. They have both drink and desert two for one deals, and a pleasant staff. We must have visited this place four times during our seven night stay in South Bank. Clean, well lit interior convenient to the London eye. One of the best values in the area.

XtVDmKyYP_6ueoGof4Dnag.text: Thought i would have a bite to eat here and relax for a little while.  I ordered the smoked haddock fishcake salad.  It was pretty tasty...although i didnt have much of a smokey taste to it. The waitress was very attentive at first and then once i was done she disappeared.  I waited a good 30-45 min for someone to help me and even then I had to chase her down to pay the bill.  Bet they would be more attentive if i just walked out without paying....thats just not my style though.

photos.caption: Photo of Slug & Lettuce - London, United Kingdom. Smoked haddock fishcake salad

2U4XFjlmlg7HFZULWQTuIA.text: Worst burger ever! The beef was hard and dry. Toilet didn't have paper towels, and according to them they just had one chef so the food was delivered late.

JtcEvuCtj1mKhb9_nnuAOg.text: HIT OR MISS---Some servers just suck, but then again, it's London, where customer service is basically non-existant.1/2 off food Mondays? 2 for 1 curry Tuesdays? 2 for 1 cocktails thurs-sat after 4pm?! YESSIR!Having a great location right by the London Eye, and close to my work, I think Slug & Lettuce is great! Going in for drinks/dinner is lovely. Besides the fact they chose to hire too little servers, I think it's a great place. The cocktails are nice, very fruity, my friend thinks their pretty strong. We ordered nachos as starters, but it wasn't that nice, very stale I feel and the cheese was overly cooked, it was like dried? The guacamole was nice. I tried the southern fried style chicken wrap, all i gotta say is that it was quite delicious! normally its like 5pounds, but with half off food, it was about 2.50pounds. Comes with a coleslaw as well. My friend got the open chicken pie, yes get it! It was great, the chicken melts in your mouth. The pastry was very nice and it comes with chips.We ordered "water" and she brought us 2 bottles of still water..that came out to be 1.85 pounds each. OUCH. I just wanted tap water! Our server seems to be quite busy, but did make a point to check on us every now and then, and be sure to tell them you are ready for your Main, or they won't bring it to you!*The 2nd time I came, it was 7pm on a Monday, the other server ignored us, and when I asked to be seated she just told me rudely all the dining tables were taken and walked away. Did not even try to give me a wait time! So we left. RUDE!!! but because you are luring me with your half-price food mondays, i will probably come back. Oh the life of a poor Uni student!mojito- awfulstrawberry margarita- delicious

ydvcJhLf4oV-d_XVmxduSw.text: The service was really poor, slowly and not educated.. Also I ordered a steak as medium well but it was burn..

_-0tQIfKa_U-4tOAcduIPg.text: I came here for lunch after a long morning of exploring London by foot. We were drawn in by the sign outside that advertised 50% off all food on Mondays, can't beat that! It was around 3PM when we got here and the place was basically dead. The server came to our table promptly but then took a while to bring back drinks considering we were the only ones in the whole place. We had *plenty* of time to browse the menu. They offer a wide variety of sandwiches, salads, flatbreads and a few meals as well. I went for the burger with bacon on top, a side of wedge fries and a spicy chili coleslaw. My boyfriend got chicken with watercress, tomatoes and mushrooms on top. My meal was decent but the burger was a bit boring. His meal was missing the sauce and tomatoes when it was delivered and took a while for the server to come back out with the items. Portion sizes were good. Overall, the food was decent but nothing spectacular and the service was just okay. The nice thing about this place is the environment, the decor had a very chic and upscale feel considering the prices were more of a middle-of-the-road kind of place. Considering we got the half off monday special, it ended up being a reasonable cost for our meal and for the most part we left happy & full. A-Ok overall.

faf6NgPynbGX6Zy0SYX9qA.text: Great experience at this branch of the Slug and Lettuce with really attentive staff despite it being a really busy Monday night (when they offer 50% off food! Remarkable value) We even tried a couple of their special Bollywood cocktails which were absolutely delicious. Will definitely return to this chain again.

wV-qlXkdLJZADFmYuxKL1Q.text: Food is average in general. Tried the half chicken with BBQ sauce. Initial tasting was great - the meat was tender and the juices seeped into your mouth. But subsequent tasting of the chicken breast revealed that it was quite dry and difficult to swallow. The salad was quite lifeless and unpalatable as well. On the whole, an okay meal but unsatisfying. Thankfully, we arrived on a Monday, hence prices are halved.

photos.caption: Photo of Slug & Lettuce - London, United Kingdom. Half chicken with BBQ sauce.

jSPHDxoLw306nfUEYAHD-A.text: A promising menu and beer selection, but we were decidedly underwhelmed. The lasagna was only an inch thick and burned at the edges, with uneven cheese on top; the large-size burgers stuck out on all edges from the medium-sized buns. The chips were cold. Unfortunately, it was one of very few restaurants open on a Sunday evening in Waterloo.

SDxSBvq11VSQiupk0KI8gw.text: My boyfriend and I stopped here for a quick coffee and cookie before heading on a Duck Tour across the street. It was a quiet morning, so we had our pick of places to sit. Our server was very nice and we enjoyed our lattes and sweets. It was a good choice for a little touring break. I looked at their regular menu and based on the selection and amazing special offers, would be inclined to give them a chance for a main meal. I left with a good impression. I didn't realize that they were a chain at the time.

gqii3JC75QEmm_KeDvU-9w.text: This place was pretty full as it was around rush hour when we went.  Service was a little slow but the food made up for it.  I ordered the chicken platter and the thing was huge.

IpgvKQRwaV9m7SVwcr1TZA.text: We chose this place mainly due to the proximity to the show we were attending. When we arrived, the place was pretty packed. There were no tables available for a party of our size. We did notice a large table with a "reserved" sign. We asked if we could have it. We are very happy when they obliged. After that, the service was good, and the food was pleasing. We enjoyed this place!

bC3WJb6OYx1XjB6Yr49Jnw.text: Incredible location right next to the London eye. That's the end of the niceties. After reviewing the menu I ordered a hot toddy to warm up a bit. I was told it wasn't on the menu and then when I pointed it out they got the bartender out who also said it wasn't on the menu. At this point I was willing to get something else but it was getting a little awkward and they just kept saying that they could do it. Then a manager came out and asked how I liked my hot toddy's made. I said again that could order something else but they insisted on making it. The fries were half fried and bland and the fried chicken sandwich looked like it had been sitting under a heat lamp for hours.

UD1QFic21ZEyYA1ZHH6W8w.text: 2 for 1 drinks! That's all I have to say!! This location was close to the hotel that we stayed in (park place Westminster bridge) so we walked here. We ordered appetizers and drinks and the food was truly enough to fill you up. They played current top 40 music and there's also a downstairs area that we explored. They don't really have a traditional wait staff so just go to the bar and order. Simple menu, well mixed drinks! This place has figured It out

photos.caption: Photo of Slug & Lettuce - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Slug & Lettuce - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Slug & Lettuce - London, United Kingdom

7Mxg8g5P9LD56BjOfvxRFg.text: Slug and lettuce: If you long for the days when airlines served food, come here and re-live the good old days!  I had the "butternut squash lasagne with spinach, goat cheese and roasted tomato"  and the best thing about it were the skinny fries that came with my son's cheeseburger. I could not detect any goat cheese but the dish seemed to be covered with something that appeared to be mashed potatoes.  My son gave his burger 2.5 out of 5 stars.  Hubs had quinoa chili, and when I asked him how it was, he said his beer was fabulous. (Estrella from Barcelona). In short, it seems like a good place to have a beverage, bit skip the food if you can.

SdA7yuvt5_kZdxMx1uRnOQ.text: I just want to start by giving a few warnings/tips. At night Slug and Lettuce becomes a full on bar. They do still serve food, but the place is PACKED, plays THE LOUDEST MUSIC EVER, and everyone is drinking. No one under 18 is allowed inside. There is a full bar/club downstairs and the restaurant area is upstairs on the street level. You will not be seated when you arrive unless you stand around dumbfounded long enough, so just go ahead and grab a table. There is some table services, but the waiters may take a long time to come to you. You can always just head up to the bar to order your food and drinks. Food: As far as food goes, Slug and Lettuce was pretty "meh." The menu is on the small side. Everything was fine, but nothing great at all. Portion sizes are average. Food prices are a little high, but nothing outrageous. The big attraction here is definitely the alcohol. They have some GREAT deals, which are available all day. We opted for the 2 for 1 cocktails. Drink prices are definitely higher than average, but with a 2 for 1 or happy our deal they are completely reasonable. Service: This is definitely not a typical restaurant. Service is really inconsistent and slow, but they're all friendly. They do eventually come by your table and take your order, but we had to wait a half hour almost. They are very quick about drinks, however, and they're very good about asking if you want another round. Atmosphere: As mentioned, Slug & Lettuce is definitely club/bar above all else, at least at dinner time. Don't come expecting a relaxed or upscale dining experience. The place is SUPER CRAZY LOUD because of the music and all the drunk people around. Also, it can get quite smokey inside due to everyone smoking right outside the entrance. The decor is quite nice.

AJXpxeEFW7yhL_ygStgvJQ.text: My sister and I came here the first night we were in London after coming from the London Eye, which it was in close proximity to. It was a Friday evening and was pretty packed, as do be expected since it was the weekend. We were able to seat ourselves and then a staff member came over to help us momentarily. Although we didn't order drinks there were good drink specials going on. I was kind of bummed because I wanted to veggie mushroom burger but I ended up getting a salad which was good. It was kind of noisy in there but a lot of people were in there for happy hour. The food came out pretty quickly and the waitress was nice. I will be back next time I am in London.

WMzQwda-kM3FGbxSwtYPkg.text: Horrible Place.  Poor service, poor attitudes.  We sat for 20 minutes and were completely ignored.  Finally asked a person who looked like was in-charge, he just said " yes someone will be there".  Few minutes later a server came.  He took the order, and then came back to us saying "he couldn't read his own writing".  Had to replace our order.  Didn't bring drinks out until after food was served.  Had to remind him for drinks... Food quality is also 1star worthy... Bland, flavorless..   They are surviving due to location and tourists being close to the London Eye...

-FiMSVRJSU_Q_1HLR_EEXg.text: Good experience FoodTook sometime to come out but the orders were exactly as we requested Decent portions Service Tye staff was ok. This is a "seat yourself" restaurant which makes it hard for the staff to keep track of new customerEnvironment Open space and modern decoration Music playing in the background There is a large bar areaTip:Sit near the bar it makes it easier/faster to get the waiters attention

Fc3zxpnFJu3CxGFWJwyxfA.text: The atmosphere is great, the food was okay, and the drinks were pretty good. I ordered their platter and it ended regular fried food. It didn't have any real flavor but it the did the job. Their mojitos need work because there was way too much chopped ice. It should be simple: mint, sugar, white rum, limes, skinny glass, a few ice cubes and done. This one felt like a snow cone. Their drink sampler on the other hand was great. The mojito in that one was smaller so it was tastier. I didn't have anything else do I can't judge their food too much so I give it 3 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Slug & Lettuce - London, United Kingdom. Their drink sampler

BxYorYTWhpKhf-pKdaOVMw.text: A-OK for lunch and going in knowing that you are in a touristy area of Tower of London. Due to heavy volumes they must receive, it did appear that staff is indifferent here, took a bit to be served and we were thirsty!One pet peeve was that it says 2-1 Cocktails-- all day sounds fab, right!? My hubby ordered a bloody mary and I ordered a jameson and ginger. I guess mine was not a cocktail, you need to order a specific cocktail so be aware of that if you care for the deal. The snacks we ordered were just ok, some small plate tacos and a burger that was ok.. I was happy to be inside after a brisk walk about the Tower grounds in London in November,  so this was a nice place to relax a bit.A-OK for what it is.

gwK7QrnSOZS1QvSnJsrJkA.text: Mediocre food and service. Drinks were watered down with 10 cubes of ice. Beware nice location but everything was substandard

YZuAmiB-eTmq_imT0w7Yyg.text: I am visiting London and came here for dinner. The atmosphere is great, but it did seem like it was becoming a night club the later we stayed. The food was pretty good but it didn't look/taste like the menu description or picture and it came out room temperature/ warm. The service wasn't great. Our waiter was gone for 15-20 minutes at a time. I didn't order drinks but they have a lot of cocktails at reasonable prices, especially with the 2 for 1 deal.

c30GcbFpMwAX2yNr2QxuXg.text: A big group of us came here before the cinema as we thought it would be a good place to come for a few drinks & a quick dinner.I would usually excuse poor service if we had come in unexpectedly as they may not have been expecting to be as busy, but this is always a busy location and I had booked a table in advance. I also explained on the booking that we would be arriving from 6pm (some at slightly different times, as & when we all finished work) for some food and drinks, and would leave in time for an IMAX showing at 8.30.I wasn't expecting the food to be gourmet, but I was expecting it to be edible. I ordered the Chicken Mango & Avocado Burger which is described as a 'grilled chicken fillet, topped with fresh mango, tomato chilli salsa and sliced avocado'. What arrived was dry and burnt chicken breast in a stale bun and a tiny smear of tomato sauce. The only plus point is that there was half an avocado on top, but unfortunately it was completely unripe and rock solid. There was also no sign of the mango at all! I ordered that burger as I thought it sounded exciting and flavoursome, but it was bland, dry and the ingredients were clearly not fresh. I complained to the waiter that it was burnt and about the lack of mango, he very unapologetically told me that had run out of mango and that was the last chicken breast, so he couldn't get the kitchen to replace it. Eeeexcellent.To make matters worse, the rest of our group then arrived at 7.30pm and when they went to order food from the waiter he told them that the kitchen had closed. He very rudely told us that this was 'normal practice' and that they stopped at that time every evening. We questioned this as on the front of the menu it very clearly states 'food served until 10pm'. The manager eventually came over and (very begrudgingly ) agreed to put their orders through as we had said on our booking we would be ordering food.When the food for the 2nd group did arrive half of it was missing. They ordered the 'feast for friends' which arrived without ribs, breaded mushrooms and grilled chicken. Once again they didn't acknowledge nor apologise for it, and seemed to hope we wouldn't notice. When we did complain about it he said that we could have some free chips (?!), and said it was impossible for them to refund the meal as the only person with authority to put a refund through was not there.Every time he came over the waiter had moaned to us that they'd had a very busy 3 days and were short staffed. I had only made the booking for our table the day before, so in my opinion if they were aware they were that busy and short staffed they shouldn't have accepted my booking as we could have happily found somewhere else to go. If we weren't in a rush to get to a cinema screening afterwards I would have made more of a fuss as this was one of the worst paid dinner experiences I've ever had. Really, really poor.

photos.caption: Photo of Slug & Lettuce - London, United Kingdom. Chicken Mango & Avocado Burger...burnt and with no mango

m3VzFnLleAHNZ9UDil6zkQ.text: Ok, so not a great start when we arrived, we were kinda left standing around like lemons, but once we got our table it got a whole lot better. We got a lovely Spanish waiter, who really took the time to recommend wine to me and helped us with our food choices. This definitely added a star for me.Food wise, it was happy Monday so everything was half price and bargain tastic. I think for full price, I'd have given 3 stars because it's a bit pricey for a pub/chain restaurant, but half price it's a steal, so no surprises it was packed. I got the salmon, which was quite flavoursome and came with a few wedges, kinda a small portion and was definitely in need of a side - which my friend ordered in the form is sweet potato fries! Oh nom nom, seriously good! She got the butternut squash lasagne which she was loving. So main courses, ticked the boxes and then for the best part of the meal - dessert! That did more than tick the box - it blew the box out of the water! So frickin good! We both got the Irish cream and ameretti cheesecake and I'm glad we did, because that is one thing I wouldn't want to share! No words - shamazing!!

photos.caption: Photo of Slug & Lettuce - London, United Kingdom. The cheesecake! Oh my
Photo of Slug & Lettuce - London, United Kingdom. Sweet potato fries
Photo of Slug & Lettuce - London, United Kingdom. Salmon

rCxCQZCz45n_Aw4ySXdvhQ.text: I very much enjoyed the atmosphere at the Slug & Lettuce, the food was decent but we weren't there for the food. We were there for the 2 for 1 cocktails from 4-10pm.  The first night we went, I ordered the Cherry Cola cocktail (you must buy two of the same exact drink to get the 2-1 deal), both drinks came at the same time. It tasted just like a cherry cola, with no alcohol. I got 4 of them before we left and I felt nothing, not even the slightest hint of a buzz. Their alcohol pour is short, very short.  Our waitress was Marta, she was amazing. So friendly, happy to be there and helpful when it came to drink and food suggestions.We decided to try again the following evening as it was our last night in London. We had told Marta we'd come back to see her before we left, when we arrived, she had reserved a table for us, which I thought was very nice! This time, I ordered the Long Island iced teas, 4 drinks in and had a nice buzz, unlike the night before with the cherry colas. Next time we're in London, we'll make sure to stop in, but only if they still have the 2 for 1 cocktail deal.

oagGAkMTODmRvpHDsPlNmg.text: Awful. I knew better than to come here because I avoid all restaurants near tourist areas. That said, my kids were hungry and needed something quick so we came to the Slug and Lettuce. Took 40 mins to get food. Wife had chicken and avocado wrap. One bite was enough. Sons had bacon cheeseburgers and ate a quarter of it. Mind you, these are 16yp growing boys who rarely turn down a burger or anything for that matter. Buns were stale and patty was dry.Daughter had a couple of bites of the chicken and bacon sandwich. Rubbery and stale bun. AwfulI had a Fullers LondonPride that was in the cask too long. Left 75% of it. Did not eat anythingAwful place. Avoid at all costs

JaRXH3PF_YAQ0rcc4bRUlQ.text: Great food, friendly service and good prices.  Had a quick lunch and though they were slow to get to us and missed my Mother in Laws entree we still had good fun.  The cute and sweet server was amply horrified she or the kitchen forgot the order but it finally came and all was good.  They took the item off the bill and made good.  Enjoyed the tall beers, fish & chips and the kids liked the noodle boxes!  Casual and clean...a welcome respite from the traffic and weather.  We American's were in a hurry and they did not make us feel what they may have been thinking (Ugly?)

36rXAbB6me7Hi1lxrKnFQA.text: I love the name of this restaurant. We ended up here as its location is close to the London Eye. British fare in a lovely, spacious space. The food was good, pretty basic. I had the fish and chips (as you have to have them at least once while you are in London as a tourist) and have had better elsewhere. The mushy peas had mint in them which caused them to be a brighter than normal green. I had a hard time deciding how I felt about them. They were not bad, but the flavor and texture was a bit odd. My cousins had burgers and reported that they were good. We were here during off hours and it was not busy. This may be why our service was better then what other reviewers experienced.

photos.caption: Photo of Slug & Lettuce - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Slug & Lettuce - London, United Kingdom

EniLiZGoTLBw0UgcAuA1Pw.text: Checked into this place last night after we rode the  of . Shared house salad and a sloppy Mac burger wit the wife. Very good, but expected more sloppy! Only came with a spoon full of Mac n cheese in the burger. Had a pint of London Pride that went down nice/smooth. Shared the carm/Choc fondue for dessert and was simply D-Lish. Service was ok, our waitress was hard working, but overmatched with all the customers.

photos.caption: Photo of Slug & Lettuce - London, United Kingdom. Fondue Heaven

OYOn7u0BTbvV3HYkne8P9g.text: I loved this place and it was so convenient. My hubby and I went to London and stayed at the London County Hall.. and decided to scout the neighbourhood for some place to eat. So we  agreed on trying out Slugs and Lettuce for breakfast.Trying to embrace the London/ English culture we chose to have the "Traditional English Breakfast" with their "Traditional English tea with milk and sugar" OMG! it was so good! and the portion sizes were HUGE!! (we're Canadian btw, so our sizes are smaller than most places). I was so full I seriously didn't even have lunch. Everything was just amazing! The server was so polite and helpful. I think this place is great for a budget breakfast. (7.50 pounds for the dish and tea)
